nodes.title: 08/30/23 Weekly Meeting 122 Notes/Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 122 is happening on Wednesday, August 30, 2023 from 9:00 AM PDT (16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PDT (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).

We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).
We regularly use the # omi-meeting-chat channel for text chat.

Who we are and why we're here:
The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal.

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

Agenda

1. Past meetings transcribed and fireflie'd, SO GOOD! thanks jin. Need this link pinned somewhere, even on website mainpage?
https://hackmd.io/@XR/omigroup/https%3A%2F%2Fhackmd.io%2F%40XR%2Fomi_8-23-23
Working groups update: 
2. glTF
3. MSF
4. <agenda in progress :) >
5. M3 open day recap: https://mirror.xyz/m3org.eth/mTtZNs7XXNAQfLeqn6VCc7Nj5-9PIDBjlwNZ88EBb6U
metaverse festival:
7. NAME? 
      1. "Metaverse festival"
      2. OMIFES
      3. . OMIFEST / OmiFest: Open Metaverse Interoperability Festival
      4. MetaVerseCon: A conference dedicated to building an open and interoperable metaverse.
      5. OpenMeta Expo: An exposition showcasing the efforts towards an open metaverse.
      6. InteropFest: Celebrating the strides in interoperability in the metaverse.
      7. VersaThon: A hackathon-style event focused on creating an open metaverse.
3. Platform?
   1. concerns with hyperfy
   2. but portals possible. Turning it around, hyperfy could be a portal, with different starting platform.
   3.  an installer pack with desired platform? e.g. Like we ship overte, v-sekai and a web browser (could be a web-view) 
4. Related: 
Social VR 2023 survey: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfzkJNb1D085UZ6Nwbnq8RVf_jqQvQ4UuzozaBGiF9gp0ukPg/viewform

I got drag n drop pallete ready for burning man themed buildathon, 1pm EST friday is when planning to do a collaborative build event with M3 and Neon Buidl
![Screenshot from 2023-08-30 11-26-17](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/assets/32600939/cea750a4-7eb5-4d7e-bb7c-0bfb9dafd3c9)
1. meeting archive awesome! summaries more than raw markdown, and also useful to train AI models for future problemsolving etc.

2. Need more people to show up for glTF. 
WIFM? Aaron: frustrated by content sucked into Unity packages. Want more openness. 
so what is the strategy ?
Started looking at vehicles, but physics need to be done first.
How do we get people excited about physics then?
gtTF is ratified, but the physics spec the team is working on is not ratified yet.

TODO: Async the next month, send links to  Hyperfy / Spatial etc the github links about the glTF Physics issues.

TODO: Brainstorm if we can get e.g. physics academics interested to collaborate. They are niche and may be OK with new standards.

TODO: Summary page (on hackmd) of these github issue links, tell the story. 

ideas: show integrations between our glTF Physics and other standards, to show that it works well together.

dovetail the more technical hackathon proof of concept models, and the more community focused events. To combine with e.g. speakers, hackathon, and show-and-tell. - jimmy6dof to write this idea up in a bit to unpack the thinking.

5. We've been doing virtual events for 5 years now, we're pro at it now. We're looking to expand, help and run events with other communities. Can do on any platform, is being recorded and documented and summarised. Yay!

6. Metaverse name: There is a poll open for the name, open until Friday 1 September. 
https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/976535598313644113/1146487699486801951

The poll will also be shared / duplicated / cross posted on Twitter etc. for input (results may be weighted).

nodes.title: 08/23/23 Weekly Meeting 121 Notes/Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 121 is happening on Wednesday, August 23, 2023 from 9:00 AM PDT (16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PDT (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).

We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).
We regularly use the # omi-meeting-chat channel for text chat.

Who we are and why we're here:
The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal.

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

Agenda

UPDATES
0. Lots of agenda items, start with asking what is urgent and dealing with that first.
1. Recap from [last week's meeting](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/412). Notes? Recording? Fireflies.ai?
2. Media group: 
2.1 We need to get in touch with a virtual burner to have a campfire event, chat about lessons from their 2020 multiverse initiative, possible colaboration. [Media meeting notes](https://github.com/omigroup/media/discussions/66#discussioncomment-6732337) Does anyone know anyone?
3. Date range for [Metaverse festival]((https://hackmd.io/@indiebio/metaverse-float-parade)) - mid October 2024. What clashes to look out for?
4. XR showcase: 
4.1 Feedback from [M3 Demo Day](https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/830454514682167356/1143022786789507165) - jin
4.2 "Anybody know any other online communities bringing together XR devs from different projects to share their work via in-world events besides M3?" - via [jin comment](https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/830454514682167356/1143246496360321084). Is this something we can host as OMI?
5. Funding from metaverse festival, how to get money in, and what to do with it if we have it - see [jin comment](https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/830454514682167356/1142453952949006456) 
6. glTF working group
7. MSF 
8. Other working group updates?
9. Call for nominations and volunteers for the next election. Is this for W3C or internal for OMI? Is there a difference?
9.1 [indiebio nomination](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/410#discussioncomment-6683620)
10. AOB
meetup in https://upstreet.ai/m/#0,0?
Burners: ask Evo for contacts.

4.2 "Anybody know any other online communities bringing together XR devs from different projects to share their work via in-world events besides M3?" [ in virtual]  - there are ecosystems, like edtech communities, - @avatarjoy to give links please. 
OpenSIM conference (not VR capable / not as VR focused but there is a VR ...browser thing) completely FOSS. Host your own server etc. 
MalBurns: with focus on interop not great, slow ... 

WebXR there are possibilities, Hubs ... web-based may be good, can easier jump between worlds / tabs...? May be better for interop.
There, Mozilla Hubs have hosted conferences in virtual.
M3 and webXR monthly meetups are active.

Metatraversal series of events also. @evo works with them. @KEYFRAME also involved there, can speak to potential collaborations. more info on MetaTr@versal https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBRnEdbmKvanvN8rtfnzApw
Could someone with Google access please add the media group meeting to the OMI calendar?
5. Funding, figure it out later, for now do peer-to-peer

glTF working group: We are working on syncing with Microsoft's physics https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions/pull/185. Lyuma suggested to wait until Microsoft clarifies the trigger grouping behavior. iFire suggested we continue independently.

MSF: end of November do a retrospective about why meetings are low energy,low engagement. Have many many members, but very few shop up. Silo issues. Low collaboration in-between. 
wrt virtual conference, virtual avatars group has momentum, wearables group good traction... 
Needs focus? A clear objective? Needs something actionable to take away. "WIIFM?" What's in it for people to contribute?
Better agenda items. Not well organised. 
A clear vision? What is the answer to "So What?"
Not much engagement outside of meetings.
@jin [comments on Discord](https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/830454514682167356/1143947268785979433)

![image](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/assets/23474368/4b093f2f-5b31-4c37-b690-fb50c9e64854)
via @madjin

9. How has nominations worked in the past? Historically no change. The champions are self-selected, which is separate from W3C. Is there an improved way to do this?
Best to discuss this in the Champions meeting.

nodes.title: 08/16/23 Weekly Meeting 120
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 120 is happening on Wednesday, August 18, 2023 from 9:00 AM PDT (16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PDT (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).

We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).
We regularly use the # omi-meeting-chat channel for text chat.

Who we are and why we're here:
The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal.

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

Agenda

**UPDATES**

hi OMI <3 I am OOO today (in San Fran!) I will likely miss our meeting due to a conflict.  - @mrmetaverse
- Call for nominations and volunteers for the next election.
- new card is requested, once approved we will get fireflies turned on to transcribe our past and future meetings! 
- let's set a date/range for the parade? Also, what do you think of a Metaverse Prom? Like what if we bring a date/friend to Prom. Maybe it's someone who we want to pull-in to our world. Maybe it's someone who already builds in the Metaverse. Would be cool to see something like a metaverse prom where we call-in others to be part of our community. 
- Metaverse Festival October 2024 see [HackMD draft information for page on OMI website to start spreading the word](https://hackmd.io/@indiebio/metaverse-float-parade)

nodes.title: 08/9/23 Weekly Meeting 119 Notes/Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 119 is happening on Wednesday, August 9, 2023 from 9:00 AM PST (16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PST (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).

We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).
We regularly use the # omi-meeting-chat channel for text chat.

Who we are and why we're here:
The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal.

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

Agenda

I'd like us to build things together. I also have to get with Jin to talk metaverse.dev, and need to relay the discussions from last Fridays champions sync: new chair election, Open Collective Update

- Metaverse Festival October 2024 see [HackMD draft information for page on OMI website to start spreading the word](https://hackmd.io/@indiebio/metaverse-float-parade)

**UPDATES**

comments below
OMI is an W3C accredited research body

Elections soon. There does not seem to be formal documentation about the chairs/"leadership"? of OMI. We should have something. Some resources shared by the group to help with this:
- https://hackmd.io/@mrmetaverse/omi-tasks-audit (Edit: this basically covers it. but would be good to look at e.g. BigScience and see if it's worth updating)
- https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/834825299438731325
- THese guys have a well articulated govenership for open source collaboration orgs  .....   https://bigscience.notion.site/BigScience-214dc9a8c1434d7bbcddb391c383922a

Call for Chair Nominations: 

- we have one vacant chair seat. 
- champions feel we should hold a new election, as availabilities have changed, and we have some new contributors who have more time to contribute. 
- nominate yourself or others in the comments below :point_down: 

re: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/410#discussioncomment-6682492

jin proposed getting a Fireflies subscription to help with archiving and note taking: https://hackmd.io/@XR/omi-fireflies. 
Formal proposal: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/411

# Vote passed: Fireflies 
![image](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/assets/63426722/d95dcabc-5e9f-4039-9a85-4abbc1e2d385)

https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/hyperfy-simple-cars-parade-float-d1a2b04bc8684e31a2c59923630ec516

test world for the festival (I think) https://hyperfy.io/cars

Follow up from last week: media meeting: Tuesday (AUG15)  16:00 - 17:00 UTC

Recurring meeting is on the second Tuesday every month at 16:00 - 17:00 UTC (24:00 Format) to accommodate MSF commitments. .....?

https://github.com/omigroup/media

and follow up about recording links - fireflies should fix where to find these, streamline this.

UPDATE: We were approved to join OCF under 501c3 fiscal sponsorship. But still need to work out the zeroing the balance thing. 

![image](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/assets/63426722/42589a9e-96c8-49ea-8bfe-4e9023f0d876)
